feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KENNICOTT GLACIER DAMMED HIDDEN LAKE RELEASING... Hidden Lake, which is dammed by the Kennicott Glacier, has begun to release and may cause a significant rise on the Kennicott River at McCarthy. The Kennicott River water level prior to the release was 1342.5 ft, gage datum, on the river gage. Expect water levels on the Kennicott River to rise an additional

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: …High water on the Tanana River into the Weekend… The Tanana River is running near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. This is the result of a combination of heavy rain and recent warm weather causing significant snowmelt and glacial runoff. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to gradually fall some over the next few
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: High Surf Warning issued July 14 at 4:03PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Warning remains in effect... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 15 feet, with surfs up to 20 feet, will impact west, south and east facing shores exposed to the large southerly swells and strong tradewinds. * WHERE...All Islands of American Samoa.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued July 14 at 9:44AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Wind Advisory remains in effect... * Breezy trade winds with higher gusts is expected to continue to impact the islands today... * TIMING...through Saturday * IMPACTS...Expect possible downed tree limbs as well as shifting of loose and unsecured small objects due to strong winds. Gusty
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:41AM PDT until July 15 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH NIGHT THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore each night this week through late Thursday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 845 PM PDT THIS EVENING... entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dimmit County through 1045 PM CDT... At 1002 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Catarina, or 12 miles south of Big Wells, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.summary: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY FOR THURSDAY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with a high temperature of 110 possible. * WHERE...Palo Duro Canyon.

entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 98. * WHERE...Utah Valley. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued July 14 at 9:02PM AST until July 17 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Beaches of northern Puerto Rico, eastern Culebra and eastern St. Croix.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued July 14 at 2:11PM PDT until July 15 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... .Elevated fire danger expected due to breezy conditions and low relative humidity. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR641, WA690, AND WA691...
